title: Trump Indictment Is Going to Make US Politics Even More Divisive
description: Public faith in the criminal justice system was already eroding—thanks in large part to the former president.

title: DeSantis Says Won’t Help Extradite Trump After NY Indictment
description: Ron DeSantis attacked Manhattan’s District Attorney and signaled that Florida wouldn’t help extradite Donald Trump after the former President was indicted in New York over hush money payments to a porn star.

title: Read Trump’s Full Statement After His New York Indictment
description: Read the full statement by Donald Trump after he was indicted by a grand jury in New York:

title: Trump Indictment Breathes Life Into His Grievance-Driven Campaign
description: Donald Trump’s indictment on charges related to the payments of hush money to a porn star breathes new life into his favorite campaign tactic — running as the aggrieved victim of a Democratic-run Deep State hellbent on keeping him and his supporters out of power.

title: Biden’s Asia Adviser Says There Are Still No Safeguards in US-China Relations
description: President Joe Biden’s efforts to put a floor under the rapidly deteriorating relationship with China have not yet succeeded, Biden’s top Asia adviser said Thursday.

title: Thaksin’s 36-Year-Old Daughter Looks to Take Down Thai Generals
description: Thailand’s most popular politician, Thaksin Shinawatra, hasn’t set foot in the country since 2008. Now his 36-year-old daughter is the latest family member seeking to push back against the military men that helped oust him — and potentially bring him back home.

title: Trump Is Indicted in New York Over Stormy Daniels Hush-Money Payments
description: Donald Trump was indicted in New York for directing hush money payments to a porn star during his 2016 campaign, a historic event in American law and politics that is certain to divide an already polarized society and electorate.

title: Finland Clears Last Obstacle to NATO Entry With Turkish Nod
description: Turkey’s parliament voted to approve Finland’s membership in NATO, removing the final obstacle to the accession of Russia’s Nordic neighbor into the defense alliance as its 31st member.

title: Trump Super PAC Puts $1.3 Million Into Taking DeSantis Out of 2024 Race
description: Donald Trump’s Super PAC is putting serious money behind his amped-up rhetoric against Ron DeSantis in a bid to take out his primary rival before he can even launch a campaign.

title: New York Comptroller Presses Blackstone on Child Labor Use at Meat Plants
description: New York State Comptroller Thomas DiNapoli pressed Blackstone Inc. for answers on how it plans to address what he called “abhorrent” child labor violations at a cleaning contractor owned by the private equity firm.

title: NYC Mayor Adams Piles Onto TikTok, Reigniting Outcry Over the Kia Challenge
description: New York Mayor Eric Adams joined the crowd of lawmakers blaming social media for society’s ills, saying he wants to   hold the platforms accountable for a growing number of car thefts in the city.

title: Tesla Pursues US Plant With China’s Dominant Battery Maker CATL
description: Tesla Inc. is looking to build a battery plant in the US, according to people familiar with the matter, in what would likely be a controversial arrangement with China’s dominant electric-vehicle battery manufacturer.

title: McCarthy Says Republicans Finalizing Bill to Address Debt Limit, Spending
description: House Republicans are finalizing a bill combining an increase in the US debt ceiling with spending cuts, energy deregulation and other GOP priorities, Speaker Kevin McCarthy told reporters Thursday.

title: Senate’s Push for Fed Transparency Gains Support After Bank Failures
description: Support is growing in Congress for imposing greater transparency requirements on the Federal Reserve as the central bank faces increasing scrutiny for its response to recent bank failures.

title: White House Proposes Tougher Bank Rules, New Tests After Crisis
description: President Joe Biden’s administration is calling on regulators to tighten the rules for mid-sized banks, the latest step in its response to the banking crisis that led to the failure of a pair of regional lenders.

title: Texas Bar Seeks to Revive Trump Ally Sidney Powell’s Ethics Case
description: Texas state bar regulators are pushing to revive their disciplinary case against conservative attorney Sidney Powell after a judge tossed it out due to “numerous defects” in court documents.

title: Lockheed F-35 Jet’s Crucial Software Upgrade May Take Another Year
description: Delivery of the first F-35 with upgraded software that’s crucial for the US fighter jet’s advanced capabilities may be delayed for another year — putting it 16 months later than originally planned, a lawmaker disclosed.

title: Putin Orders to Draft 147,000 Russian Conscripts by July 15
description: President Vladimir Putin signed a decree to enroll into the army 147,000 conscripts aged between 18 and 27 during the spring draft.

title: White House Demands GOP Budget They Think McCarthy Can’t Deliver
description: President Joe Biden is digging in against Kevin McCarthy on the debt ceiling as the White House seeks to exploit divisions in the GOP caucus and a House speaker they believe lacks the votes to pass a budget proposal.

title: Venezuela Offers to Push Back Deadline on $60 Billion Debt Pile
description: Venezuela will push back a legal deadline on $60 billion of defaulted debt in a bid by President Nicolas Maduro to prevent creditors from filing a wave of lawsuits while he attempts to regain recognition from the US.

title: Peru’s Congress Delays a Decision on President Boluarte’s Impeachment
description: The vote by lawmakers on a presidential impeachment motion now expected next week

title: House Passes Sweeping Energy Bill That Curtails Biden's Climate Law
description: House Republicans passed a sweeping energy bill that would repeal parts of Democrats’ marquee climate law and boost US oil and gas production in the first main policy initiative of their new majority.

title: Biden Special Counsel Taps Trump-Era Duo in Probe Over Documents
description: The Justice Department special counsel investigating whether President Joe Biden mishandled classified documents has brought on two former Trump administration officials to help.

title: South Africa Determined to Exit Dirty Money List, President says
description: South Africa needs six months to demonstrate the effectiveness of two new laws that aim to curb money laundering and financing of terrorism as it seeks a quick exit from a global financial watchdog’s dirty money watch-list, President Cyril Ramaphosa said.

title: Sunak Sees Brexit Boost as UK Nears Indo-Pacific Trade Bloc Deal
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak hailed the prospect of the UK joining an 11-nation Indo-Pacific free-trade bloc, amid expectations that accession will be agreed as soon as Friday.

title: Biden’s Chief Economist Navigated a Pandemic. She Still Sees Threats ‘Every Which Way’
description: Cecilia Rouse, the first Black American to lead the Council of Economic Advisers, departs amid new uncertainty.

title: Senegal Opposition Leader Sentenced to Jail in Defamation Case
description: A Dakar court sentenced Ousmane Sonko, the most prominent challenger to President Macky Sall in next year’s presidential elections, to two months in prison for defaming a government minister.

title: Macron Slams Unacceptable Violence at Protests in France
description: French President Emmanuel Macron criticized mounting violence at recent protests against his plan to reform the pension system, calling on opposition political leaders to join him in condemning it.

title: Janet Yellen Says Bank Deregulation May Have Gone Too Far
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen warned that deregulatory efforts that watered down some post-2008 financial reforms might have gone too far and contributed to the recent banking crisis.

title: Disney Outmaneuvers DeSantis in Clash Over Theme Park District
description: Walt Disney Co. pushed through changes designed to limit external control by the board that effectively governs its theme park ahead of a controversial takeover by hand-picked representatives of Governor Ron DeSantis.

title: New Bill Seeks to Set Nurse Staffing Minimums After Hospital Strikes
description: Two US lawmakers are proposing legislation that would set minimum staffing ratios in hospitals and establish whistleblower protections for nurses in response to high turn in the wake of the pandemic and a series of recent labor strikes.

title: UK Delays Decision on When to Raise State Pension Age to 68
description: The UK government delayed a decision on when it will increase the state pension age to 68 amid slowing rises in life expectancy.

title: Bolsonaro’s Brazil Return Draws Supporters and Security Concerns
description: Former Brazilian president returns home after three months in Florida to re-energize the right-wing movements he inspired

title: China Seeks to Reassure CEOs as Worries Swirl Over Potential War
description: Between China’s increased military aggression around Taiwan and reports that Beijing will supply Russia with weapons, the global business community could be forgiven for getting nervous about a possible war.

title: Turkish Lira to Weaken No Matter Who Wins Elections, Bank of America Analysts Say
description: Bank of America Corp. analysts say the Turkish lira will weaken regardless of who wins the election in May.

title: UK Unveils Green Program With Little New Cash to Fight US Plans
description: The UK unveiled its strategy to speed up the deployment of renewable power and capture carbon, but the plan to boost energy investment in Britain lacks the financial might of efforts in the US.

title: South Africa Rules Out Ending Friendship With Russia
description: South Africa’s government will not break ties with Russia at the behest of other countries, its foreign affairs minister said ahead of bilateral talks.

title: How US Industrial Policy Is Changing the World Economy
description: While President Joe Biden embarks on a tour to promote the impact of his economic agenda on America, it’s already sending shockwaves across the globe.

title: China Politburo Reviews Rules on Officials’ Personal Disclosures
description: The top decision-making body of China’s Communist Party reviewed rules governing the personal disclosures of top officials, a sign President Xi Jinping is holding firm on his anti-corruption campaign.

title: Top UN Court Rejects Iranian Bid to Free Assets Frozen by US
description: THE HAGUE, Netherlands (AP) — The United Nations’ top court on Thursday rejected Tehran’s legal bid to free up some $2 billion in Iranian central bank assets frozen by U.S. authorities to be paid in compensation to victims of a 1983 bombing in Lebanon and other attacks linked to Iran.

title: EU Warns on China’s Assertive Actions With Call for Open Dialog
description: The European Union’s Ursula von der Leyen warned of a deliberate toughening in China’s strategy, with a new era of security and control, but urged the bloc to respond by working to reduce risks rather than decouple from the Asian nation.

title: Xi’s New Vice Premier to Oversee Finance, Housing in Shake-Up
description: China has tasked its Vice Premier He Lifeng, a close confidante of President Xi Jinping, with the mandate of shoring up the nation’s embattled property industry as well as the $60 trillion financial sector, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Ferrier Faces 30-Day Commons Suspension for Covid-19 Rule Breaches
description: Covid rulebreaker Margaret Ferrier could face a by-election as a Commons standards watchdog recommended she should be suspended from Parliament for 30 days.

title: Russia Detains Wall Street Journal Reporter on Spying Charges
description: Russia’s Federal Security Service said it detained Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich in Yekaterinburg on spying allegations, the Interfax news service reported Thursday.

title: South Africa Urges UAE to Provide Update on Gupta Extradition
description: South Africa’s government expressed concern that the United Arab Emirates has yet to provide an update on a request to extradite Atul and Rajesh Gupta, who are wanted on charges of money laundering and fraud.

title: UK Reboots European Ties With King Charles’s German Visit
description: King Charles III will deliver a speech to members of the German lower house of parliament during his first state visit as monarch, billed as a test of Britain’s soft diplomacy in rebuilding European ties frayed by Brexit.

title: Protecting Koala and Emu Habitat Could Fuel a $91 Billion Market
description: Australia’s government wants to create a market to preserve the habitats of koalas, emus and other native fauna — an effort that could be worth A$137 billion ($91.4 billion) annually.

title: Ukraine Latest: Zelenskiy Urges Even Stronger Democratic Unity
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called for even greater unity among democratic nations, which he said would enable those committed to the rules-based international order to fend off the threat of tyranny.

title: Vietnam Chief, Biden Discuss Boosting Ties at ‘All Levels’
description: Vietnam’s Communist Party General Secretary Nguyen Phu Trong and US President Joe Biden discussed strengthening bilateral ties across the board during a phone call on Wednesday.

title: Why Kenya Has Been Rocked by Opposition Protests
description: Raila Odinga has run for Kenya’s presidency five times. In each case, he alleged that he was cheated of victory. He came within a whisker of getting the top job in 2022 but was edged out by William Ruto, whose win was upheld by the nation’s highest court. Odinga now says he has proof the contest was rigged, and he’s called on supporters to stage twice-weekly protests until Ruto’s victory is nullified. While he has scant chance of succeeding, the upheaval is spooking investors and undermining Rut

title: German Public-Sector Wage Talks Fail and Will Go to Arbitration
description: A third round of wage talks for 2.5 million German public-sector workers ended without agreement overnight and will go to independent arbitration, raising the prospect of more transport disruption in Europe’s biggest economy.

title: Malaysia’s Anwar Urges China to Reenergize Belt and Road Plan
description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim made a pitch for China to reinvigorate its Belt and Road Initiative, as he urged for collaboration among countries.

title: President Macron’s Autocratic Bent Jeopardizes His Reform Plans for France
description: In ramming through a change in the retirement age, he may have made himself a lame duck.

title: Singapore Urges US and China to Stabilize Ties Amid Tensions
description: Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong urged the US and China to stabilize ties between one another and warned that any clash between the super powers would have “grievous consequences for themselves and the world.”

title: IMF Chief Urges Faster Debt Restructurings During Visit to China
description: The world urgently needs faster and more efficient processes for restructuring debts of vulnerable countries, the International Monetary Fund’s chief said on a visit to China, a nation that many fellow fund members including the US accuse of blocking advances.

title: Ecuador Constitutional Court Allows Lasso Impeachment to Proceed
description: Ecuador’s Constitutional Court will allow the congressional impeachment trial of President Guillermo Lasso to go ahead, the court said in a statement late Wednesday night.

title: Key Petro Allies Withdraw Support for His Colombia Health Reform
description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro’s bid to reform the health system is at risk after after two allied parties removed their support Wednesday, the second of his major initiatives to face significant pushback this month.

title: 12 Dead After Ferry Catches Fire Between Philippine Islands
description: MANILA, Philippines (AP) — A ferry carrying about 250 passengers and crew caught fire between Philippine islands and at least 12 people were killed with seven still missing, a provincial governor said Thursday.

title: South Korea Makes Rare Public Criticism of North’s Rights Record
description: North Korea uses public executions to strike fear into its public and tramples over the freedom of its people, South Korea said in a report on human rights abuses by its neighbor almost certain to draw Pyongyang’s anger.

title: Mexico Government Says Agents to Blame for 39 Migrant Deaths
description: The fire in an immigration facility in northern Mexico took the lives of 39 of the migrants trapped inside after both private security and federal agents failed to allow them to exit, Mexico’s top security official said Wednesday evening.

title: Break Up India’s Biggest Firms, Ex-Central Banker Acharya Says
description: India’s biggest conglomerates, which wield immense pricing power in the retail, resources and telecommunication sectors, are contributing to elevated inflation and should be broken up, a former central banker said.
